content:
Hey, Drupal 7 users out there,
are you using i18n in D7 projects?

This is sort of a poll to figure out the most used i18n submodules.
Which ones do you always turn on, which ones do you hardly ever or never use?

And as this is a Backdrop chat - what i18n functionality are you missing the most in Backdrop core?

Looking on the biggest i18n D7 site I manage, we've got:

  • Blocks (there is some block translation in core now, which could be improved)
  • Fields
  • Menu (there is some menu translation in core now)
  • Content
  • Path
  • Sync
  • Taxonomy (I'd flag this one as the biggest weak spot, maybe...)
  • Redirect
  • Variable
  • Views

from a complex multilingual site we maintain:

  • Administration language (admin_language)
  • Block languages (i18n_block)
  • Contact translation (i18n_contact)
  • Field translation (i18n_field)
  • Menu translation (i18n_menu)
  • Multilingual content (i18n_node)
  • Multilingual forum (i18n_forum)
  • Multilingual select (i18n_select)
  • Path translation (i18n_path)
  • Rules translation (rules_i18n)
  • String translation (i18n_string)
  • Synchronize translations (i18n_sync)
  • Taxonomy translation (i18n_taxonomy)
  • Translation redirect (i18n_redirect)
  • Translation sets (i18n_translation)
  • User mail translation (i18n_user)
  • Variable translation (i18n_variable)
  • Views translation (i18nviews)

I have not tried to move this site to backdrop yet so I can't speak to the needs, but want to note that the client that this site is for has been unhappy with i18n in general in Drupal7; they have been told that D8 sorts this out better and I am hoping that by the time they are ready to do something new, Backdrop will also do this better.
So, my question; has much/anything changed between D7 and Backdrop in how i18n works?
Do you have more detail about the pain points they are dealing with?
I've asked them to write it up and I'll pass it along

Hi @indigoxela great that you tackle this issues... I did a lot of multilingual projects in D7 and also one in Backdrop (https://herzpraxis-schuetzenmattpark.ch/en/welcome). The most urgent one could be the i18n Variable module. The current core taxonomy works pretty well, IMO.
@mazze.ch Just to verify I understand it right - currently in core you can have multilingual taxonomy but not translated taxonomy, right?
@mazze.ch I'm afraid, for i18n Variables we will need a complete new concept.
@Laryn I think you're correct. There is no "translation set" in core. Only for content
i18n variable is not an end in itself though. What exactly is it needed for still?
@Laryn you are right with the taxonomy issue, it's not a translated entity.
